31602494.review:
So upfront I just wanna say I absolutely love the Blazblue series and I have been playing the PS4 version of this particular title for a long time now ever since the Japanese release, so I maaaaaay be a bit biased here, keep that in mind.

First I'm gonna go over some Overall review stuff and after that I'm gonna focus on the Quality of the Port:

If you're looking for your typical "airdasher/anime fighter" you're gonna be right at home with the Blazblue Series.
While, yes I agree, that the balancing in previous titles was a bit questionable, I have to say that I am really happy with how Central Fiction turned out to be.
As always every character has a very unique playstyle and if you're like me then finding specific things that work and figuring out combos with each character is a freaking blast. The new character additions: Hibiki, Naoto, Nine, Izanami, Es, Susanoo and Mai each are extremely fun to play and look fancy ingame.
Having all of the old characters as well though means that you are going to see the rise in quality (mainly sprites and animation) with each generation. While the new characters are very fluent in motion, some of the old characters CAN look a little choppy at some points but they still all work great together.
Sadly this title lacks a bit in the "content" part compared to some previous games in the series. Which does not mean that it has no content besides battleing vs CPUs/Players or Online noooo far from it.

You have your typical modes like:
-Arcade (with 3 different ladders/acts depending on the character. Each tells a different part of their story)
-Versus (fight against the CPU or friends locally)
-Score Attack (fight against CPUs to get as much points as possible by doing different things)
-Training
-Challenge Mode (basically a given nowadays, lets you practice beginner-hard combos for every character)
-Tutorial Mode (explains the main mechanics of the game, duh)

About the Story...I'm not gonna spoil a thing I just wanna say it's a hit or miss wether you like it or not.
It is and has always been pretty much a visual novel with the occasional fight here and there and SOME choices which basically only change whether you progress in the story, get a bad ending or you might also see a joke ending...which I have to say are still freaking well done and pretty damn funny.
I personally really like the story however confusing it might be and I was really looking forward to seeing an actual ending. Only thing I'm gonna say is "I was not disappointed...only a little sad...NO IM NOT FKN CRYI-"

Blazblue also always had some fun bonus modes that you could look at like:
-Abyss Mode
This has been changed quite alot in the series...I actually like this one the least.
It basically is a mode where you fight on increasingly more difficult ladders and earn more stats and items for your character to power you up and defeat ridiculously powerful bosses.
One thing I have to say about this though is that the bosses may be frustrating but some of them are extremely interesting to fight and can teach you a thing or two.

-Speed Star
Now this is something new. Speed Star is an interesting thing. Basically you have different difficulty settings in this mode which decide how many enemies you are going to face and how hard they will be. In this mode you do not take damage. Instead you have pretty long match timer in the beginning and everytime you take damage time gets taken away from you. However everytime you do something good like damage the opponent or pull of Hypers or long combos you get more time added to your timer. The Goal of this mode is to keep your timer up during the entire ladder to finish it since time gets carried over to different fights. Pretty fun actually also rather challenging.

----

Alright! Technical shit time!:

New Mechanics introduced:
Exceed Accel - basically a move that can only be done during overdrive by pressing all face buttons at once does around 2k normally and 4k with "Active Flow". If you do not have Active Flow while hitting this it will put you in Active Flow. Since these moves are safe and can punish you for just pressing a button they can be rather annoying especially considering that they deal 4k with Active Flow. They scale pretty hard in combos though. You can also simply hold down all face buttons while not in Overdrive to enter Overdrive and immediately do an Exceed Accel to piss of everyone on the face of the planet...or maybe just me, but the can be pretty handy as combo finishers since the will put you in Active Flow or can still deal a decent amount even in a combos during Active Flow. Finishing off an opponent with this counts as an Overdrive Finish. Now I mentioned Active Flow a ton so...what is it?

Active Flow - basically the opposite of Negative Penalty status. When you fight aggressively you enter Active Flow, which boosts damage and your recovery of the Burst Gauge. Active Flow is pretty hard not to notice since your character emblem in your side is gonna start glowing and the announcer will yell out "Active Flow!". If you have Active Flow but no burst gauge your empty burst gauge will glow instead. Also an Exceed Accel during active flow will always have a different animation then without AF.

Changes:
Same Move Proration - Now I only really think that there is one big change in Central Fiction and it's that "Same Move Proration" is removed. So basically you can have the same specials and normals loop multiple times in a combos but the damage is gonna scale pretty damn hard.

----

Now let's talk about Online Play:
You have a couple of modes here: Ranked, Player Matches and Open lobbies.
Open lobbies are big lobbies you can join..each room holds around 32 players and there are multiple servers for each region. You can even customize a little avatar for yourself to run around in these lobbies. To get more stuff for your avatar you have to use ingame currency to play what is basically a slot machine.
In Player Lobbies you can even customize the entire room yourself which is pretty cool! You get a ton of options to choose from but most have to be drawn from the slot machine.

Netcode:
Now...I know the netcode is not perfect...far from it, but it is by no means horrible. When I play with people from Europe I have little to NO delay...it can however in rare instances freeze for a very short time.
The ingame "Delay" display is...pretty stupid...it doesn't tell you jack shit most of the time where it told me that I would have terrible delay in a match the match was so fkn smooth you could slide on that shit all day.
Maybe thats just for me but it's basically not a good indicator.

-----------------

OK! Now the thing that you all came here for! The Port!:
One good thing upfront..You get ALL THE DLC with this Port! that said...
I was really suprised with how bad it was at launch...it seemed rushed and unpolished compared to the great ports of the other titles.
Now don't get me wrong it's not horrible, in fact it is getting patched alot!
but there are still some issues that bug me a bit.
I gotta say I seem to be one of the lucky people that does not have any issues with Framerate whatsoever so if you're looking into that I can't really help you. I am playing on butter smooth 60fps all the time. No matter what happens in the game. (same goes for the guy I play with alot)
I am also not really "qualified" to talk about keyboard controls since...I don't hate myself so much that I would play on keyboard...I'm joking!....memes?...sorry.
Now what really really REALLY bugs me are the sprites and text and all that...they looks so...ew.
I know that they are going to fix this and I'll probably change this review if they do but right now everything is a LITTLE weird looking except for the character portraits and all that...that's the thing that bugs me the most.

SO overall I absolutely recommend it since the developers are still working on fixing everything. "Good" Port of a great Game!

31592728.review:
It's really nice to see that this game is being dug out of the mixed reviews hole it got shoved into at launch. While the game did, and probably still does, have some issues from launch, the patches have been steady, and addressing the apparent issues. 

As for the game itself, I'll just list some pro's and con's, based on my own opinion.

PROS
-Bigger roster: All of the added characters were definitely a nice edition. They're all pretty fun to play, and mix well with the original cast.
-Art Direction: The character art, as well as the background art for the stages, is exemplary. The backgrounds especially, are even more detailed, but they still mesh well with the 2D character sprites during combat. 
-More ways to play: There was another increase in the amount of game modes, leaving players with even more stuff to do.
-Nice Story: The story was indeed nice, and I'd say probably worth the wait to finally play this game. It wrapped things up pretty well. Was it the best story in the series? Probably not, but, it definitely did a good job of providing closure to questions, and wrapping things up.

AMBIVILANT
-The Gache: While I understand the intent of it, I'm uncertain how I feel about it. I'd say I probably disloike it more than like, but it isn't a big enough issue to truly fall under CONS. It does suck to only unlock one new item in a spin though.
-The D-Code is relatively the same, though I don't approve of the character limits in the Title section.

CONS
-Streamlined Story Mode: The story itself was definitely good, but the story mode was much too stream lined. You could literally sit there and barrel through the entire main plot, and leave all of the sub scenarios for later. While this did offer an amount of choice in your play, it would leave you confused about some of the events during the main story. Some of the stuff definitely wasn't involved in the main story, but in my opinion, it would have been better to just make it all have to be played. Especially since the way you had to do things for the main plot to flow together smoothly was: "Play a main story chapter-Unlock a sub scenario-Save and quit-Go play the sub scenario-Reload your save and continue." Otherwise, the main story was left with some holes.
-Lack of English voice acting and subs: I definitely have no issue with reading subtitles, and the Japanese voice acting cast is superb. But I've been playing these games in English since Calamity Trigger, so it's odd that there is no English voice acting. I found myself reading the subs in the english voice actors voice. That aside, the lack of subs for intro battle conversations in V.S. mode is irritating.
-Jubei not playable: I don't care what anyone says, this is a bunch of bull. #CalamityTriggered

EDIT: They’ve done it! The big little cat man is coming! YEEEEEEESSSSSSS!


Above all, if you like Blazblue, or enjoy 2D fighters, pick up Central Fiction. It's definitely worth it. The port had some issues at launch, but those are consistantly being addressed. Enjoy your time everyone.

~Fuzzykins

31591663.review:
The game Blazblue Central Fiction for PC has received many mixed reviews, but I believe when it comes down to it the pros outweigh the cons. This is why I would recommend the game. 

Pros:
-Story Mode: The BlazBlue series has been known for having one of the most indept and amazing stories. As a long-term fan, this version's story gripped my heart-strings with it's multiple chapters and sub stories. The story is very long as well, so there's tons of content that will keep you busy and won't make you bored. For new fans of the series, this game added a new mode called Library. This is where you learn about each characters story all the way back to '08, what new has happened in the story, each of the multiple families, cities, weapons, etc. The beginning of the game even includes an optional explanation of what has happened in the last version, so you're not lost. 

-Soundtrack: The inside of the game includes 62 songs, and (i'm not entirely positive on this) 10 new songs added. There even is a picture on top of to each song, so new fans know what song is which characters theme. In my opinion each games soundtrack has been absolutely phenomenal! Songs range from those you can jam to while fighting you opponent, to songs that make you very emotional. Central Fiction even includes some old opening from previous games. The opening and ending as unusal is very nice. 

-Characters: Five new characters were added to Central Fiction: Es, Nine, Naoto, Hibiki, and Izanami. These and all the other characters in the roster have a very unique and fun story and fighting style. Everyone has a different play style, so there is a character for every fans style. 

-Offline Gameplay: For those who are not interested in playing online, BlazBlue has tons of offline modes for you to choose from! First off for those brand new to the series, Blazblue has there own amazing tutorial mode. I personally have noticed that each new version's tutorial has become better and better, and this game has yet to fail. This game teaches fans everything they need to know from beginner lessons to advancerd lessons. They even added character specifics for those seeking to learn the strategies of certain characters.Those still seeking to learn BlazBlue also has a new and improved challenge mode, where you learn easy-expert combos for every character.  And finally a training mode where you can put your new moves to action!  Once you've learned the game, they're multiple fun game modes. These include, Arcade mode where it's arcade style battles where you fight and learn parts of the story, V.S. mode where you fight a cpu, which you can set to any difficulty in the options. The ever lasting and intriguing Abyss mode, where you fight multiple waves of enemies, level up your charcter, and create items to make your character stronger. Score Attack mode where you pick a course and fight enemies ranging in difficulty, and a new mode added Speed Star Mode, where you beat enemies as fast as you can for the highest score. In the end Central Fiction offers multiple options offline so you have tons of stuff to do!

-Network:  For this version out now of Central Fiction they're Pros and Cons for the Network mode, So i'll go over the Pros first. In my case I have seen a huge improvement in it's coding. I rarely find matches where it's lagging. I also found that the changes to Player Matches are a big improvemewnt as well. They're more items and avatars for your little Avatar, now there's two plates, a D-code that shows all your stats, and a vs Plate shown before as match. I think it's a great idea to have more ways to customize plates. There's also more options to customize you room with new items and more themes. 


Cons:
-Network: Now onto the bad things i've seen from the network. -Sprites:T̶h̶e̶ ̶s̶p̶r̶i̶t̶e̶s̶ ̶o̶f̶ ̶t̶h̶i̶s̶ ̶p̶o̶r̶t̶ ̶s̶o̶ ̶f̶a̶r̶ ̶h̶a̶v̶e̶ ̶l̶o̶o̶k̶e̶d̶ ̶p̶r̶e̶t̶t̶y̶ ̶p̶i̶x̶i̶l̶a̶t̶e̶d̶.̶ ̶I̶ ̶p̶e̶r̶s̶o̶n̶a̶l̶l̶y̶ ̶h̶a̶v̶e̶n̶'̶t̶ ̶h̶a̶d̶ ̶t̶h̶i̶s̶ ̶a̶f̶f̶e̶c̶t̶ ̶m̶e̶ ̶p̶l̶a̶y̶i̶n̶g̶ ̶t̶h̶e̶ ̶g̶a̶m̶e̶,̶ ̶b̶u̶t̶ ̶m̶a̶n̶y̶ ̶o̶t̶h̶e̶r̶s̶ ̶h̶a̶v̶e̶.̶ ̶I̶f̶ ̶i̶t̶ ̶i̶s̶ ̶r̶e̶a̶l̶l̶y̶ ̶b̶o̶t̶h̶e̶r̶i̶n̶g̶ ̶y̶o̶u̶ ̶t̶h̶e̶ ̶g̶a̶m̶e̶ ̶l̶o̶o̶k̶s̶ ̶p̶e̶r̶f̶e̶c̶t̶ ̶a̶t̶ ̶7̶6̶8̶ ̶a̶n̶d̶ ̶1̶0̶8̶0̶ ̶w̶i̶n̶d̶o̶w̶e̶d̶.̶ ̶A̶g̶a̶i̶n̶ ̶t̶h̶e̶ ̶d̶e̶v̶e̶l̶o̶p̶e̶r̶s̶ ̶h̶a̶v̶e̶ ̶b̶e̶e̶n̶ ̶w̶o̶r̶k̶i̶n̶g̶ ̶o̶n̶ ̶p̶a̶t̶c̶h̶e̶s̶ ̶t̶o̶ ̶f̶i̶x̶ ̶i̶s̶s̶u̶e̶s̶ ̶a̶s̶ ̶o̶f̶ ̶t̶h̶i̶s̶ ̶v̶e̶r̶s̶i̶o̶n̶.̶ ̶

-No Eng. Dub: Central Fiction has been released with no English dub. This personally doesn't affect me, since I always had it on Japanese, and I read the Story modes subtitles anyways, but for those anticipating an English voiceover there is no such thing as of now.  


EDIT: As of recent updates, most of the cons have been patched and fixed, making this game now highly recommeded!  9/10 

In conclusion, I believe that Central Fiction is worth it, because it holds multiple options and gameplay offline and online, the story, soundtrack and characters are unique, beautiful, and amazing. And finally any issues can be resolved by developers and in the options.

31589192.review:
Storywise: BlazBlue is a little convoluted, and much more so if you haven't played and well-understood what happened in the previous games, even with the recap. It would do any newcomer well to play through the earlier games first, or have a friend to help explain things here and there. It's a long story, a lot of the first half is covered in the Arcade modes if you've already watched the old translated japanese versions, and its very drawn out, picking up around the end of third quarter. At that point, the story is no longer covered by the Arcade modes very much.
But, at the same time, there are a few deus ex machinas BlazBlue pulls off near the finale. If you're willing to overlook that, put up with a lot of terminology, and want to get to know these characters from start to finish (namely, the 3 protagonists are almost two different people compared in the first game to the last), I think you'd like it. I got emotional several times during the story.

Be warned; some of the transations in CF are a little shoddy, and may not be entirely accurate to the japanese script/original terms from previous games. It's not too bad though and personally I didnt have a problem with it, it's only really annoying if you're very nitpicky.

Gameplay: There's a lottt of different playstyles that a roster like this can support, and you're bound to find one character that resonates with you. Some are easier than others, of course, others in general are just better or worse because of the specifics of their moves and damage/health/etc. I can't speak for everyone because personally, I'm not too good and don't look into specifics like frame data and the like. But BlazBlue is still fun and looks nice nonetheless with all the nice spritework. (not to mention COM difficulty can be adjusted from Beginner, to Hell mode, depending on how versed in fighting games you are.)

For those who either really want to avoid entering inputs and skip through the fighting game aspect to just play the VN portion of it, there's Stylish mode, where hitting one button repearedly pulls of a string of light attacks in a combo, another for medium, another for heavy. I still recommend to always play technical though, or else you're missing out on the primary aspect of a fighting game.

The only issue regarding gameplay is my laptop can't handle stage with a lot of lag or background animation, such as Old Gate or Factory, which makes stationary stages like Lessons ideal if you don't have a high quality pc. Furthermore, getting the hang of the controls is a little hard, but not impossible and before long you get used to it and play the game fine. I recommend binding A + B + C + D to one key, to make activating your Overdrive ability easier.

I haven't played online yet, but stages with little lag are ideal still to reduce the processor power needed to run a smooth match. 

Personal issue: Though I've already beaten story mode, characters like spoile///rss///usa///noo///spo//ilers haven't shown up in offline vs. mode, and neither have any of the other unlockables.

Final thoughts: Love the series, like CF, could have been improved in some aspects and the patches will hopefully fix up the remaining issues with the port (as of this review there's already been 2 updates), but otherwise a nice game and I recommend it. Newcomers might want to wait for it to go on sale again so they dont spend 40+ on a game that has a confusing plot and even more plot holes. Or alternatively just have a friend give you a quick rundown on anything else you might wanna know.

31560329.review:
It's the most recent installment of BlazBlue and is the same version that's available in arcades and on consoles.
The game includes all the DLC from the get-go, no need to unlock any characters through the means of in-game currency.

The game currently suffers from pixelated sprites, though it can be easiliy remedied through the use of 3rd party software, but do note that using these applications will likely raise the system requirements for the game to run smoothly. Developers are still looking into the issue and trying to get it fixed.
The level of improvement achieved using the basic settings for the 3rd party programs can be seen here:
http://imgur.com/a/ilBWz

The online netcode is decent. When playing users in the same region it's practically spotless, but during intercontinental matches (northern Europe -> US east) there's a quite notable delay - worse than what I experienced in Xrd playing the same person.

In terms of offline content, there's a ton of stuff to do. They cut some game modes, added and tweaked others. They're all very fun and it'll probably keep you occupied for many hours.

Overall, I haven't experienced a lot of issues - most of which were patched within a day or two after release. If you're on the fence - definitely give the game a shot, and in case it doesn't run properly/live up to expectations you always have the option of refunding.

31558722.review:
I both love and hate this game.

Blazblue is probably my favourite fighting game franchise of all time, because I'm a huge fan of it's flashy, mobile,
super long combo orientated combat. I also personally like the characters, I think their ridiculously cliche anime
style is fun, and the soundtrack has always been fun.

I've seen other people bashing this port for things like not accepting their controllers and arcade sticks and looking
horrible, but personally I haven't really noticed either of these. It looks almost the exact same as it did on console to
me, and that's mainly because I'm playing on a gaming laptop rather than a flatscreen tv now. Controllers have worked
100% fine for me.

My biggest gripe with this game that almost made me want to give it a negative review is that it, for the first time, does
not have any english voice acting. I know a lot of people prefer the Japanese dub, and for a lot of games I do as well,
but Blazblue was in English the first time I ever played it, and I stuck like that since. The fact that the FINAL GAME is the
ONLY one in the main series that isn't dubbed is just frustrating. If I'd played the other games in Japanese it would have 
been acceptable, but they WERE in English, and this is the only one that isn't. 
Personally, I find that inexcusable, but, I still love the characters, gameplay, and incomprehensible storyline in the game,
so I'm giving it a positive review because I still dig it. But I'd give anything to get the English voice acting back, even
if I had to wait another series of monthes and pay for DLC.

On the plus side, this version of the game comes with all the DLC characters for free in comparison to the console version,
so that's cool :)

31558652.review:
If you play on keyboard with a certain layout or two, you may have to jump through some hoops to get the same layout here you had in CP:E or earlier, since the way this game handles keyboard is quite different.

That aside, this entry in the series is a satisfying conclusion if you haven't grown too attached to the dub (which has not and will never happen, officially). Interesting new characters, tweaks to old characters, and a couple new mechanics that are fun to incorporate. Grim of Abyss mode is fun once you can work around the timer spelling your doom when the CPU's at pixel health and running away (recommendation: Max Overdrive and Burst Booster), and you can blow your in-game money on gacha items to decorate your room/lobby!

I could never bring myself to care much for the story, but it's there, and--I seem to recall reading--in large part responsible for the massive install size.

Some people say online is dead but I don't get those people. I have NO trouble finding casual matches when I seek them--though perhaps having like 8 steam friends who own the game is an unfair advantage. Everyone who's even vaguely interested in anime + fighting games should give this a try, even if they have to wait for a sale. Review over.

31551995.review:
[b]
　“...成为神的少女永远不会醒的梦，然后不断重复上演相同的历史。我们就身处这样一个记忆被篡改的世界...看不到一点希望，得不到一点救赎。”

　少女没有回头，但她知道那个人在听。

　“小白兔，怎么连你也在说这种‘没用’‘办不到’的丧气话，就是因为这样我才想要去拯救。”

　“拯救么...果然只有你这种跟虫子一样差劲的男人才能这么轻松的说出来吧？”雷琪尔皱了皱眉头，突然的雨夜让她十分不悦。即使是艾卡多城，也会有下雨的时候呢“拉格纳·布莱德艾奇...死神...黑色魔兽...”

　“随你怎么叫，我吞噬太多人的愿望了。但我啊，想创造一个人类自己可以奋斗，掌握自己命运的世界。这就是我的可能性。”

　“说什么傻话，你知道这意味着什么吗，拉格纳·布莱德艾奇的存在会彻底从这个世界抹去。”

　这个傻瓜，即使到了这种地步，还在天真的自以为是...不，如果不是这样的话，反而不像他了吧？

　“啊，无所谓了。那么，再见了。”

　“．．．．．．”

　雨更大了，但少女只是待在原地任由洋装被雨水打湿，阴郁的表情仿佛下一秒就会哭出来一样。[/b]

[h1] 写在开头[/h1]
　2014年，诺瓦玲偶然接触到了《苍翼默示录》这款游戏。那时的拉格纳还是个在迦具土四处破坏‘窑’的危险人物。随着剧情的推进，我们认识了一个个性格鲜明的人物，哈扎马、雷琪尔、琴恩、小椿...似乎除了我们的愣头青主角外，所有人都在有计划、有组织的干预这个世界，仿佛这一切都只是一个被预演过无数次的巨大舞台罢了。

　“苍之继承者”、“观测者”、“苍之魔导书”、“黑色魔兽”...从角色对话的只言片语中不断重复着这些隐晦难懂的专业名词。直到这时，诺瓦玲才知道这不仅仅是一个普通的日式格斗游戏，它有着一个庞大的故事，一个森利道和石渡太辅极力想展示给我们看的奇妙世界。

　从最初的关注到如今《神观之梦》上架steam也过去3年了，拉格纳从一个被人设定好舞台的演员一步步变成一个真正的男人。3年了，拉格纳从迦具土一路来到斑鸠，最后在那场不可能醒来的噩梦中完成自己的可能性。3年了，世界被拯救了，《苍翼默示录》也迎来了它的终焉，实际上我们早都心理准备了，不是吗？

[h1] 剧情模式再改良，意犹未尽的结局[/h1]
　从CT时期的单人故事到SE的分歧选项决定剧情走向主线or搞笑剧情，再到CE时期剧情叙述的大幅优化，再到《神观之梦》可以自由选择章节。支线剧情/搞笑剧情不纳入主线游玩过程，需单独选择浏览。

　Arc System Works从未停止过让玩家如何才能更舒适体验故事的工作。从早期猝不及防进入坏结局or搞笑剧情到现在可以自由选择想要浏览的部分。《神观之梦》无疑算是彻底解决了《苍翼默示录》系列一直以来的一大通病。

　当然不人性化的地方还有很多，仅管主线游玩中右上角会时不时提示已开启支线剧情或搞笑剧情。但还是会被玩家经常无视，而一些配角人物的故事恰好都是在支线中交代，全程游玩主线的玩家甚至会误以为这是游戏本身编剧的疏忽。外加每个支线剧情浏览完，都会退回至初始界面，支线剧情的不连贯体验也是个大问题。

　也许是因为最后一作，也可能是诺瓦玲实在不舍得这个故事的结束。仅管对故事节奏很是不满，尤其最后几个贯穿几部作品的反派人物，便当的速度快的超乎想象，但《神观之梦》还是在故事上递交了一份完美的答卷。包括搞笑剧情中每部作品都会出现的“兄岛”、“魔法少女特立尼蒂”也迎来了自己的谢幕，一切的一切都告诉我们，是告别的时候了。希望我们能永远记住《苍翼默示录》美好的回忆。

[h1] 最后一作了，刷吧，以后也刷不到了[/h1]
　本作一如既往使用点数兑换模式，通过多人对抗、街机模式、爬塔模式获得的点数，可以用来解锁人物的语音，颜色，BGM，联机房间的饰品也需要通过点数抽奖获取，全收集也是个不小的工程吧。

　因为《神观之梦》出现新的角色和剧情，街机模式全部洗牌，每个人物的经历根据其登场的作品一共有3个不同时期剧情的线路，也算是对前几作最后的致敬和缅怀了吧？而玩家们熟悉的分数挑战模式依然健在。

　爬塔模式改良为深渊模式，简单地说还是新瓶装旧酒，大体不变的前提下加入等级属性，加入了魔导书系统，技能系统。通过不断击败敌人来获得各种各样效果的魔导书和技能效果，并且支持拆解、镶嵌，这是一个网游中很常见的模式，无疑又可以延长大量游戏时间。

[h1] 角色不平衡，从SE时期留下的天梯传统[/h1]
　《苍翼默示录》的角色属性很不平衡，这一点已经是这个系列的通病了，或许对一个只打PVE的娱乐玩家来说只要能玩到喜欢的角色就够了，但对那些在天梯上“征战”的玩家来说心情只能用失望来形容了，到了最后一作也没有进行角色平衡，加上ES、麻衣等新角色简单无脑，估计又会被抱怨一阵子吧？

　从SE版本流传下来的天梯光荣传统是什么呢？经常匹配不到人，然后一匹配到就是老手痛揍新人。这一点根深蒂固，不会因为是最后一作就改变了。如果想在天梯爬段除了要有能排到人的好运气外，还是要好好磨练自己的技术呢~

[h1] 一些不得不说的小遗憾[/h1]
　《神观之梦》作为最后一作，很多方向做的已经无可挑剔了。但还是有一些小问题，让诺瓦玲感到很遗憾，不过不留遗憾的故事太虚假了，不是吗（笑）

　苍翼系列的惯例是每作换一次UI界面和人物立绘，这次的UI界面一如既往的大气，但这个人物立绘怎么说...虽然大部分角色的立绘都可以接受，但画师桑...芭烈特、阿兹莱尔什么的是跟你有仇吧，有仇吧？一定是有仇吧？？？

　帅气模式削弱，出招表修改。诺瓦玲主玩神乐·睦月，这次把D的蓄力改回来简直苦不堪言，很多老角色的出招表都修改了，对一些习惯某角色的老玩家来说很不习惯。

[h1] 尾声[/h1]
　[b] “蕾琪儿就拜托你了，大叔。”

　“不用你说我也知道。”

　老管家定定地看着眼前这个红衣男子。

　“永别了，臭小子。一想到以后再也看不到你这张脸，我的心情就好了起来”

　“哈，我也是。”

　拉格纳满不在乎的挥了挥手臂，留下那个熟悉的赶路背影，只不过这一次不是再急着去哪里了，而是彻底的诀别。

　“...再见，拉格纳·布莱德艾奇。”[/b]

[h1] 
　再见《苍翼默示录》，谢谢你给我带来精彩的故事，谢谢你带我认识一个个形形色色的人物，最后谢谢你给我带来的感动。

　即使拉格纳已经不在了，但诺瓦玲相信在世界的某个角落，一定会有个粗鲁的红衣男子继续他的旅程，一路上他会再次被桃卡卡蹭饭，再次被雷琪尔捉弄，再次被闷骚大叔拯救，再次被...因为这是属于我们的共同回忆...[/h1]

31539896.review:
Muy buen juego de peleas de la famosa franquicia que vuelve con más personajes , escenarios , historia , en definitiva más de todo.
En lo jugable añade una nueva mecanica bastante interesante , la cual nos permite realizar un devastador ataque que puede darle la vuelta a la situacion en un combate , y se mejora algun que otro aspecto.
En la seleccion de personajes contaremos con todos los que ya tenia su anterior entrega "Chronophantasma" más 7 nuevos , lo cual hace que tengamos variedad.
Se sigue manteniendo el modo Stylish , el cual esta pensado para los mas novatos y permite la ejecucion de combos automaticos presionando varias veces el mismo boton.
La historia (no la he acabado aun) pero se supone que finaliza en esta entrega , ya no debe aparecer lo de "to be continued" xDD.

Resumen:

PROS:
Completisimo plantel de personajes. (Incluye los Dlc gratis)
Bastantes modos de juego "offline" y online.
Muchos  extras para desbloquear , imagenes , voces , colores , etc...GRATIS.
Muy buena musica.
Tutoriales y modo de juego alternativo (Stylish) pensado para nuevos jugadores , al igual que desafios para los mas avanzados.
Tendremos historia para aburrir xDDD
Modo online con "Login" , lo cual nos va buscando partida mientras jugamos el modo arcade , desafios , nada de tener que estar mirando la pantalla esperando a que encuentre partida.

CONTRAS:
De salida muy mal port , ahora mismo ya han sacado 2 parches y a mi personalmente el juego no me da ningun problema , pero a muchos usuarios si tienen caidas de frames , problemas al ponerlo en fullscreen , etc....recomiendo ver el foro.
El juego se ve bastante mas pixelado que las anteriores entregas , sobretodo los personajes que parece estemos delante de un emulador de arcades sin ningun tipo de filtros.
Tengo todas las opciones graficas al maximo pero se ve igual.
El sonido (voces/efectos) parece saturar algo mas que en anteriores entregas , yo lo he bajado algo respecto a la musica.
El idioma para variar no viene en español y en este titulo es muy importante puesto que lleva toda la historia de la saga y tiene muuucha , una lastima no poder entenderla.

Valoracion final:

Juegazo de peleas de compra obligada para los fans del genero y seguidores de la franquicia , pero una lastima el descuido de ASW a la hora de hacer el port con bastantes bugs (en mi caso con los 2 parches que hay no tengo) y olvidandose por completo de traducir el titulo a mas idiomas para que los fans que compramos sus juegos podamos disfrutar la historia , un punto muy negativo teniendo en cuenta que el resto de juegos como King Of Fighters , Mk , Sfiv - Sfv etc... ya vienen traducidos a bastantes idiomas entre ellos el español.

I mean if you played the Console version, but if you are at work or on the go and just couldn't play Blazblue at home. WELL HERE IT IS!
It function just like the console verison (Minus the Open Lobby) and with my Fiber Optic (Only at home) it is actually more crispier/cleaner than the console copy. 
The only thing that is wrong with the PC copy is the Replay Theater is currently broken. What I mean is that after you exit the game and re open it, the replays you saved will pop up the message "The Data is Damaged" and some times crash the game. 
Long story short I was playing on my laptop at work and I saved some replays and when I got home I tried to open up and "Damage" message pop up and when I tried to replay the ones I played on my Desktop it just crashes. So hopefully this will get fixed and other than that, the game is fine. 
Connection wise it occurs to your png (NOT YOUR FPS FOR GOD SAKE). At home I play on a 3-6 png and at work I play on a stable 15-20 png and both are wired and before you ask. Yes. I have a ROG Nvidia 960 (Desktop) and a 970 (Laptop) graphics cards. 

All and all. Anime fighters this is a must have if you want to Lab on the go or bring it to the scenes. 
THUMBS UP TO THE CREATORS!

31494416.review:
EDIT: We finally get Jubei,  plus with the announcement of BBTT this game might see the light of day once again. Will update if it does.
EDIT2: It did, for like three or four days.
[list]
    [*]D-Input has some issues. Sometimes the game won't recognize my PS360 arcade stick, but restarting the game usually fixes it.
    [*]Bindings are a mess. Every button does at least two action, meaning if you don't use default you simply won't navigate through the menus. The "next page" and "previous page" buttons will be in complete opposite bindings.
    [*]Graphic is the same as CP. I'm not one to nitpick about visuals, but porting a sprite from one game to another is lazy beyond belief, they could at least put some decent anti alias so that you don't see pixels on every character at a resolution that isn't even that high (1920x1080). Besides put a GG Xrd screenshot next to a BB CF, no one will believe they were made by the same people. It's even worse when you realise the the good looking one is [i]older[/i].
    [*]The story recap is put into the main story, it's also just a couple lines that you'll read in 10 min. Which is kinda odd considering BBCP Recap was a dedicated chapter with more than 30 minutes explaining CT and CS. If you didn't played the previous titles, don't bother with the story. The recap barely made me remeber the important stuff, and I played through them all.
    [*]Story is completely linear now, you choose a chapter and that's it. No more different paths and/or specific character paths. There's a "sub-chapter" thing that completely break the flow too. The game will always forward you to the next main chapter, meaning whenever you see a pop-up with "A Sub-Chapter has been unlocked", you have to exit the mode and choose the chapter again. It's not that much of a dealbreaker, but I can't believe adding a "Automatically watch sub-chapters" option wasn't even considered. BBCS already put a great deal of effort in story. BBCF felt like "nah, just do whatevs"
    [*]Speaking of story, they didn't bothered adding english voices. Have you been playing a story-centered game with english VAs? Fuck you, get used to the japanese VA now, they can't be bothered to add a feature that was in all games prior to this one. I've been playing the game with voice sound turned to 0, since I can't understand anything they're saying in the story or in-battles.
    [*] For some reason, cutscenes volume is adjusted by voice volume. Even cutscenes with battles and 0 words whatsoever.
    [*]Then I tried to watch a cutscene again because I missed an dialogue. The cutscene happens after two fights in story mode, then I went to Gallery to see the cutscene. SURPRISE! No subtitles in gallery cutscenes. At least I can hear the line I missed right? No, wait...
    [*]Nothing new gameplay-wise. It's a balance patch with new characters. (Exceed and Active Flow are only important if you're thinking of going pro with high level play.)
    [*]Less single player modes, compared to Chrono Phantasma. (Still one of the best options for single-player fgs)
    [*]The whole HUD and menu is uglier than it's previous interactions. Wouldn't matter if the game itself was impressive, but it goes to show they didn't put any effort into making CF.
    [*]There are only 10 tracks in their "Soundtrack Bonus". BBCF has 35 characters, each with it's own theme... Meaning they half-assed even their bonuses.
    [*]The memorial book is 100 pages of artwork, half of which is the female cast in swimsuits and/or slathering themselves with food that resembles another white sticky stuff. (Couldn't be the actual developer's work, now that I think back on it. They probably didn't had anything to show seeing 80% of CF is a re-hashed CP.) 
[/list]

I'm not the kind who'd proceed to hate for shits and giggles, I like BlazBlue, it was my favourite fighting game series ever. I'm seriously dissapointed with this. The first ASW game that was utterly dissapointing I considered refunding, but sadly I'm the kind of person that can't leave a story unfinished, I have to see it though the end, and I hate watching YouTube for that purpose. And the story...It's alright, but not as good as the "final chapter" should be. They left a lot unexplained and an important arc had no tangible conclusion. If you ask me, the story is still OK, though not what shaped up to be. There's also only 3~4 gag reels and only one is truly new, others are a re-telling of previous Gag Reels.

TL;DR If you don't care about the story, BBCF is not the best choice... Online is mostly dead, when you do find a match, good luck figthing the same 4 characters over and over again. The single player is lacking in comparison to Chrono Phantasma. I can easily reccomend any other BB or Guilty Gear, but not this one. Here's hoping they get their shit together with BBxTT

Наверно начну с конца и скажу, что если всё-таки являетесь фанатом данной серии игр (и не только игр) то вам стоит её пройти как отличное заверешение основной истории о нашем доблестном носителе "Лазурного Гримуара" Рагне.

В данной части игры история стала ещё большей ВНкой, нежели предыдущие части, что (может быть?) и пошло в лучшую сторону. Лично для меня так даже удобней было вовлекаться в историю, не отвлекаясь на рубилово, которое можно себе обеспечить в разных режимах игры. Не упускаем из виду и моменты драматические и комедийные моменты, коих здесь было достаточно. А если брать концовку, то она хоть и была очевидна, но всё равно оставила след в душе о том, что "Всё. Думаю, нам стоит на этой ноте прощаться, а так хотелось ещё немного..." Поэтому я не желаю того времени, которого провёл рядом с этой серией.

Что касаемо геймплея? Думаю тут особо гвоорить нечего. Со времён 1ой части он особо не менялся (И опять же может оно и к лучшему?), добавлялись новые приёмы, благодаря которым вы могли создавать и поэксперементировать с новыми и ныне имеющимися комбинациями, новые персонажи со своими уникальностями и прочее. По поводу порта и оптимизации вряд ли смогу вам что-либо сказать потому, что эта серия у меня всегда работала нормально? Возможно.

Ну вроде что хотел, то написал. Заранее извиняюсь, если что-то не понятно написал. Всем всех благ!
А оценка будет: 9/10 (-1 балл за то, что они так и не сделали ни Дзюбея, ни Тринити игровыми персонажами :с)

31488181.review:
故事模式完美，在主线的基础上通关后可以进行漫长的支线。最为关键的是街机模式的庞大内容，几乎补完了大部分细节。 想要通关剧情请一定要再玩一遍街机模式。
格斗部分进行了平衡调整并增加了很多新招式。比如大小姐的蝙蝠盒子！
目前唯一的问题就是锯齿太重，不过毕竟才发售没满一周，按照森P的惯性一定会在后续补丁中修正的。

Only reason to ever buy the older games is for the story.

Netplay is decent and assuming you don't play on a laptop that has a HD graphics card it will work fine.

31479913.review:
无限轮回的世界，仅仅是位少女的梦。
历经八年，苍翼游戏的故事终于迎来了最后的结局，意料之中的发展，意料之外的剧情，因为“苍之男”的努力，终于将这场无限轮回划上了完美的句号。
一边哭一边笑地熬夜打完了主线和全部支线+搞笑剧情，看着拉格纳不断努力，最终结束了第一接触体制造的无尽之梦，没有丝毫遗憾地抱着主控单元回归境界深处的时候，不禁流下了眼泪。不断努力，不断挣扎，不断地给予他人希望，如今的他已经没有任何遗憾地离去，给他人一个最好的结局，作为死忠粉，还有什么不满足的呢……
这已经是最好的结局。

剧情总体来说贯彻了BB系列的高水准，不过因为是最终作，刀子多到飞起，系列积累下来的坑填了大部分，小部分的坑没有填，应该被分到了小说和新出的漫画去了。顺带，居然埋了一些坑，这些坑认真来说，是可以让BB出续作的（森P快打自己脸出续作啊喂！），算是一点小小的遗憾吧。
剧情采用了电影式的分镜和叙事，比起前三作来说开始会很不适应，后面就会觉得很赞了。

游戏系统方面，再次改进了系统，并且修改了出招表和招式判定，和CP相比的难度变高了，还在努力适应。OD中可以使用OD超杀这个简直好评，而且OD的时间并不是固定的，回复OD也让防御反击流派有了更多的发展，总的来说还是优秀的系统。

嘛，房间系统略微鸡肋了，还有这次解锁要的钱也太多了吧233
千万别用1080P！狗牙问题由来已久，居然CF还没解决

拉格纳终于和蕾琪尔表白了啊啊啊啊啊啊啊啊（此人已疯）

31479187.review:
El lanzamiento más controversial de Blazblue hasta ahora en Steam.
En un principio hubieron problemas con resoluciones y ciertos inputs, que fueron aparentemente solucionados con el parche lanzado.
Las cosas que se le critican al juego son:
- Sprites pixelados, lo cual si está mal y ya están trabajando en ello, pero tampoco es que sea algo tan grave como para plantar el grito en el cielo.
- Problemas de rendimiento, que en mi caso no existen en absoluto (i7-4700hq + gtx 765m, nada extremadamente potente).
- Sin doblaje en inglés, lo cual para mí es completamente innecesario ya que siempre lo he jugado en japonés, y sinceramente el que lo hayan quitado para mí es mejor, ya que ha permitido un lanzamiento simultáneo a nivel mundial (lo cual no pasó con las entregas anteriores).
- El juego pesa casi 50GB (eso sí, la descarga es de 20GB, no 50)... bueno, esto si es algo un tanto inexplicable, pero aparentemente favorece a los tiempos de carga... quizás deberían comprimir un poco más las cosas y llegar a unos 35GB? De todas formas, siempre que no tengas muy poco espacio en disco tampoco es algo crucial.
- Aparentemente el online no funciona tan bien para todos (pero al menos a mí me interesa más el contenido sp o a lo mucho para jugar con amigos localmente).

Dejando de lado los puntos expresados anteriormente, el juego está súper bien en cuanto a contenido, jugabilidad y precio; y si disfrutaste las entregas de Blazblue anteriores y quieres saber el final de la historia de Ragna no veo por qué no deberías comprarlo (sobretodo aprovechando el 20% de descuento).

ACTUALIZACIÓN:
Después de múltiples parches por parte de ASW se solucionaron todos  los problemas que existían (o al menos los más demandados) , y en especial lo de los sprites que era lo más criticado, para los cuales ahora hay distintos niveles de antialasing aplicables desde las opciones. Hoy por hoy el juego se encuentra en un estado excelente, y fuera del hecho de que pesa 50GB (lo cual puede ser un inconveniente para algunos) yo no voy ninguna razón para no comprarlo.

Ahora sólo queda esperar a Jubei.

ACTUALIZACIÓN 2:
Jubei ya está aquí!

31477648.review:
我第一次接触BB是在初中的时候，接触的是CT，之后就是CSEX和CPEX了。
这一作给我的感受有一下几点：
先说好的：
1.多了几位角色我是挺高兴的。
2.系统的语言不再是声优的名字而是角色的名字，比较好玩的地方是如果选到自己，它是不会说角色名字的而是会说一声"我"。
[spoiler]至少神乐是这样子的[/spoiler] 
[spoiler]3.CG包不用说都懂的，给我的鸡儿放几天假就行了[/spoiler] 
[h1]抛开一系列问题的话，总的来说还是给BB画上了一个完美的句号.[/h1]
下面来说说差地方：
1. 第一个要说的绝对就是优化了，先不说我的台式了,就直接拿我的笔记本来说，嗯，切独显稳定FPS20。
为了解决FPS低下我在显卡设置里全选覆盖然后调至最低，问题就轻松的解决了。虽然选人界面还是稳点 FPS20。
2.迷之锯齿让我看得很难受,[spoiler] 如果是在我的本子上玩的话把分辨率调720P，锯齿？不存在的。[/spoiler]
3.扭蛋系统是我觉得最恶心的东西了，你以为你是开箱游戏吗！我不买CG，不买颜色和诺爱尔的服装。就为了扭个破蛋，结果呢？我到底得了什么啊！
[h1]好的下面让我来说一下这些问题要如何解决：[/h1]
1.如何解决卡的问题。
对于这个问题我只想说:你不要自己跑不动就说优化差。
其实完全就是你电脑辣鸡好吧。你上这个配置：
[h1]
显卡：GTX1080ti
CPU：E3 1230V5
内存条：128G海盗船 2800M
硬盘：廉价的固态硬盘。

上这个配置你会卡吗？所以说，没有辣鸡优化，只有辣鸡电脑！
[/h1]

2.如何解决锯齿的问题

这个问题非常简单，再买一个分辨率小的显示器就行了，等ARC修复了这个问题以后你再用会回的就行了。

31473064.review:
As it is now, the port is very unpolished, and even the cards are pretty awful. Apparently, Kokonoe is a bearskin, instead of a beastkin.

After a line of increasingly solid Arcsys ports, the quality of Centralfiction on the PC is a slap in the face. Far and wide, people including myself have encountered
Variable framerate (20 - 50 in my case)
Sprite stretching/Sprite tearing
Improper kerning/font formatting
Antialiasing in-game making almost no difference
Vsync being useless, which doesn't really surprise me given my framerate as is.
JP only voices, which is a shame because the English voice actors were really quality, and for something that forces you to spend a lot of time reading (if you do the story mode), some people prefer to hear rather than read because it makes it easier to follow the flow of conversation if their eyes can focus on the faces instead of the text.
An odd bug I encountered actually caused the backlog to scroll up without pause until I hit the start menu and backed out and went back in. 
Considering I want to finish the story before I get into the meaty multiplayer, the most polished part of the past few pieces, this really is unsettling to see such a drop in port quality for almost no reason.

I will still finish this myself, however. I've already commited myself to this hellish task and I will write a full review later.

31467399.review:
1.06更新后测试了一下，选项全开，反锯齿选择“角色反锯齿”（“强”会变成迷之撸多了效果），非常清晰，目测和PS4版已没有区别，甚至ps4版不是标准的1920x1080（鬼知道为啥！），这点上steam版反而界面更清晰一些，加上其他操控帧数等的持续修正，还是很有诚意的，改推荐。
[strike]目前角色锯齿问题实在太严重了，简直刺眼。
实测相比PS4版差距非常明显，官方修正前先暂时不推荐，修正后再修改测评。
2017.5.2，考虑到测试不太严谨，关掉PS4Pro的boost模式和插值4K功能，在同一显示器以1080P为基准重新测试。
无调整下——依然较为明显，主要是人物边缘模糊，打开游戏第一眼就发现不对劲，就我个人而言无法接受。
Inspector调整后——已经非常接近，但仔细辨认仍然有微弱的锯齿差别，不是强迫症可以不用在意了。
A卡的朋友……嗯……自求多福吧，不过听说也有解决办法了，我没有A卡就不测试了。[/strike]
另外游戏界面明显调整了，选人背景对比发现清晰很多，这一点给予好评。

其他暂根据PS4版印象简评：
++精彩而足够充实的收尾剧情
++沿用前作的稳定优秀系统并有所增强改良
+依旧较华丽的2D特效
+音乐和配音依旧出色
+新角色设计
+移植Steam非常迅速
+更加精细的UI足显诚意
+丰富的其他可玩模式
---Steam版实在糟糕的马赛克移植
-更加让人脑壳痛的背景设定[spoiler]你们几个沙耶好好地把关系讲清楚[/spoiler]
-越来越有跟不上时代趋势的画面表现
+/-整体没有大的突破但比较完善

抛去那些移植问题，神观之梦为Blazblue系列画上了一个不错的句号（从伏笔来看，或许也并不是终结作）。尽管没有什么非常大的改革，但却保留了一贯的格斗体验和剧情体验，并用更多的新角色，和系统方面的完善，使游戏更加饱满。

Печально, конечно, что порт вышел таким косячным и игра нахваталась негативных отзывов. Надеемся, что все проблемы пофиксят, правда даже после этого негативные обзоры людей, сделавших рефанд, так и останутся.
Если в плане сюжета, ещё можно начать с CP, то здесь такое уже не получится, ибо подробного пересказа нет, только 30 минут в начале. и новичку вникать в происходящее будет, если не невозможно, то очень сложно.
Все технические проблемы уже были озвучены в других обзорах, поэтому о них не буду говорить, разве что упомяну, что проблем с производительностью у меня не было и что проблема с исчезновением изображения при переходе в фулскрин была для меня самой критической.
Новыми персонажами играть интересно, даже Наото и Хибики, к которым я до релиза относился скептически.
Не знаю, есть ли региональное ограничение в онлайне, но те недолгие попытки поиграть в ранговые матчи закончились неудачей, да и комнат больше трёх я не видел.
Хорошее и трогательное завершение истории, омрачённое техническими косяками. 
И всё ещё нет играбельного Джубея.

31453931.review:
Graphic 25%（visual presentation 20% art/HUD 5%）+music 5% sound 5% voice5%+technique(optimization, camera, physics, etc)10% +gameplay40%（mechanism/level design 20% combat/control 20%）+story/world settings/characters 10%

6*0.2+8*0.05+8*0.05+7*0.05+9*0.05+7*0.1+10*0.2+10*0.2+10*0.1 => 8.5/10

[h1]Pros[/h1]
+[b]Music[/b]. Needless to say, as a Spiritual Successor to Guilty Gear, BlazBlue has no right to not to have AWESOME music. All hail Daisuke Ishiwatari. BTW, BBCPEX opening song 'Blue Desire' is my favorite(listen to it [url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-oKoi8JkvCE]here[/url]).
+[b]Sound[/b]. Sound effects are being taken care of this time. Some do sound a little bit of weird depend on which move being used and the various status(being hit, on guard, etc) your character is in.
+[b]Voice[/b]. That's a fat plus here. These VA are all A-listers across Japan. If you are an anime guy, you'll definitely gonna love hearing these familiar voices in the game.
+[b]Mechanism[/b]. It's a 4-button 2D anime fighter game, which some of us would call it '喧哗流‘ due to its fast pace and combo-heavy gameplay. It's also one of the most popular 'Air-dasher' FTG which you can perform air dash and double jump(except for some characters, they have their own movement choice). That also determines its complicated yet beautiful essence, for example, you have 3 ways of neutral tech, 4 types of guard, etc etc. It'll take sometime to learn and use it in actual matches, but that's where all the fun lies, right? If you are a KOF or SF type of fighting game player, you probably are not gonna like it. (lol I don't like these two games either)
+[b]Combat[/b]. Well that's where the gem is. This game has one of the most interesting fighting system. Not only there is a Distinct 'D-Drive' system and ’Overdrive‘ mode for each different characters, the move list of theirs is also cleverly designed to match their fighting style, as well as creating entirely unique taste to every dual between 2 different characters.

[h1]Neutral[/h1]
~[b]Story[/b]. Could be one of the biggest reasons to buy this game, especially if you like gal-game or these otaku things lmao. This is the last episode for the story of the protagonist ’Ragna the Bloodedge', so if you want to have a thorough view on the whole story, I'd recommend you to start from the <Blazblue Continuum Shift Extend> which is the 2nd entry. Also, notice that this game only concludes the ending for ‘Ragna', but does not necessarily mean the end for Blazblue World. In fact, ASW is publishing a mobile game focus on the magic school daily life of the 'Six Heroes' early next year.
Story itself is worth 6-7 hours reading(each for BBCSEX, BBCPEX and BBCF which is this one), along with several novels as prequel(around 10 books or so), an anime(terrible), a manga(story about Mai? I think) and other stuff. 
 ~[b]Characters[/b]. Animeeeeeeeeeeeeee. The game comes with a very decent illustration book(pdf format) which you can find in your steam folder. 

[h1]Cons[/h1]
-[b]Terrible graphic[/b]. The series is based on hardware over a decade ago, all the sources(character image, animation, etc) are in 768p resolution. A bunch of graphic options have been added to this newest installment, though, the anti aliasing won't work properly and even if these settings are all cranked up, graphic still looks blurry as f**k.
-LOL the [b]UI[/b] deteriorates since the very beginning of the series. And this entry is at its bottom. Simply ugly.(That's not only my personal taste but also opinions of my friends)
-[b]Optimization[/b]. I have a GTX 1080ti so I don't really know what things is going on here, but from the previous titles in this game and most of the community comments here, it's not so well optimized. And [b][u]since when you've heard of a game published by Korean that has been optimized?[/u][/b]. No offense, PUBG. (Since ASW is moving to Unreal Engine, which is a much more compatible and versatile game engine, I believe the next chapter of this series will be published and ported by themselves :D)
-[b]Netcode[/b]. The community is not very active on PC. And the connection suffers from lags which could be annoying for a 60fps fighting title.
-[b]Beginner unfriendly[/b]. I played 100+ hours(well I admit most of the time is for unlocking all the achievements) and am still on the barely above noob level. The best way to deal with this and have a feeling of progression is to find a good friend at the same level, practice and git gud together.
Also, most importantly, remember to [u]play the tutorial mode first[/u]. It's very detailed and efficient in learning the basics. Or else you are just mashing buttons lol.

[h1]Some links[/h1]
#[url=https://www.evernote.com/shard/s330/sh/2854eec4-11ce-421b-af98-566102053c7c/9068e84f62f7e6f88278dd11811eec95]Fighting Games - from 101 to AP[/url]
#[url=https://docs.google.com/document/d/1iG2GfZouCfJ3kAzM1M9CkRrvZJWMGMxpA8bwwkTJSNw/edit]Basic Mechanism and D-Drives[/url]
#[url=https://keeponblaz.in/#/]Match Database1[/url]
#[url=http://horibuna.web.fc2.com/BBCF/index.html]Match Database2[/url]

[h1]As a conclusion, it's a 'wait for sale' if you are only interested in the story and a 'buy' if you are hardcore anime fighting game fan[/h1]

31446349.review:
[b]Oh man, what a letdown...[/b]

This game in itself is a great port, it supports borderless windowed mode and is more optimized than the last 3 Blazblue titles that were ported on Steam. But as a long-time player, who loved the English dub so much, I just don't like the game as much as I did the last 3 installments. To me, the dub for Blazblue was one of the [u]best[/u], with a cast of Voice actors and actresses that actually fit their roles. 

The gameplay, otherwise, is as tight and neat as usual, with no major problems. The controls feel very fluid, as well as responsive. The game offers a wide variety of characters for you to choose and main, depending on your preference.
Some characters are just better than others, but generally, the game is very balanced, and I love how it is constant throughout the years.

[h1]Pro's:[/h1]
[list]
[*][strike]Hot babes[/strike]Unique character designs
[*]Stunningly beautiful stage designs
[*]A soundtrack that fits the entire game like a glove with metal
[*]Tight controls
[*]And other fun modes to play with
[/list]

[h1]Con's:[/h1]
[list]
[*][b]No English Dub.[/b]
[*]Non-friendly controller configuration.
[*](At the time of this review) Squished character sprites that render at a wrong resolution
[*]Not friendly for low-end setups
[/list]

[h1]Conclusion[/h1]
Centralfiction for Steam is a good port, better than the last 3 games, and is far more optimized for PC. It's a fun fighter game with a rich story. There are a diverse range of characters to choose from, and there's a ton of fanservice as well. But personally, I do not recommend this game for people who were very fond of the English VA cast, cause the dub will never happen, no matter how hard we wish it to become a reality.

31444825.review:
Well to start off pretty much if you are playing this game you been following this game since calamity trigger and man the moment i saw this game released i instantly bought it. 

few things i came across was it felt like the game was very rushed wise. like optimization was not their goal when they put it on pc but still it was playable in the end. i compared the blazblue CP and this one and let say their a massive difference in quality and details when it comes to the story. but still i still played.


the Story in general was Amazing i loved it and i hate to know this is the last game now for this amazing series. but still worth the buy

Their was really on ONE concern that made me frown on this version of the game. NO ENGLISH DUB. like man why did the LAST game have to be sub only like come on like i been loving the english dub  since calamity trigger for awhile but man did that really Stand out when playing the story line on this game. But still the story line was a must to know what happen and still i loved the story.


[I still hope they are planning to make a english dub in the future for this game i would pay for it if it had to be a dlc]
 

so far overal this game is worth the buy mainly for just the story line cause thats what i mainly bought the game for casue i fell deep in love with the depth and animation of the story.

for old veterans of this game go ahead buy it.

but for someone who wants to just 1v1 everytime i say stay with CP until they  can manage to fix the bugs. but not much has changed beside unlimited mode and the combat combo feel a lot different.

BUT WORTH IT :).

今の対戦バランスに満足しない人はアップデートを待ってから購入するのが確実かもしれません
＞脳筋勢がかなり強くなったため特定キャラが増えたという

[strike] 現状はお勧めしないというか、買ったらだめ。
なぜかといえばいきなり起動すら不能になったから。(起動不能になった要因は判別できました)
不満と怒りが一定量たまったので、不満に思ったことを箇条書きにします。[/strike]

[strike]  ・起動すらできなくなった[/strike]
起動しなくなった原因は不明ですが,nvidiaの設定を変更することで起動するようになりました。起動しない要因は垂直同期を高速(Fast sync)した場合でした。
　格闘ゲームに関してはすべて垂直同期を高速(Fast sync)で遊んでいます、BBCFも同様に設定し、起動し普通に遊べていました。
　しかし、ゲーム中のオプションでの画面モード変更後に動画のような現象がおきたため、まず起動コマンドでの対処(-autoconfig、-windowed、-fullscreen)は意味がなく、クラウド同期をきってsaveフォルダを消して再発、再インストール後も再発。
　Nvidiaのコントロールパネルの設定したことを思い出し削除、その後起動成功。
　どの項目が問題なのかを確認した結果、垂直同期が高速(Fast sync)の時でした。フレンドから聞いたところ、Free syncが使えないなど垂直同期の種類によっては相性がでるようです。

[strike] ・起動できなくなる前までは遊べた(返金期限の2時間を突破する可能性があります）[/strike]

31439865.review:
这部作品因为有许多用户体验的问题，所以现在评价褒贬不一，但是还请大家听小妹一言：
第一，相信这一作有很多亲都和我一样第一时间就买了。但是由于bug的原因一开始的忠诚度折扣没有享受到，正好那天购买了就挂着下载了一晚上，第二天小妹也被拉了去看电影所以没有玩。因此得以退款了再购买。虽然小妹是得到了退款，但是我觉得对那些忠诚粉丝来说很不公！很希望Arc works能够有所作为，有所补偿。
第二，最重要的一点，也是为最多人所诟病的一点：那就是“为什么我玩刻之幻影有稳定60帧，这一作只有30帧，甚至15帧呢？“小妹一开始也遇到了这个情况，并且十分痛苦。但是经过steam讨论区的顶置贴的指导，
中文可参考：
https://tieba.baidu.com/p/5092504709 
我现在已经可以稳定地全屏60帧进行游玩了。
具体来说就是：
1.切换独显：打开NIVIDA控制面板-管理3D设置-右上角恢复默认设置-程序设置-添加bbcf.exe-为此程序选择首选图形处理器一栏选择高性能NIVIDA处理器。
2.下一个NVIDIA Inspector（直接在网上搜索即可），打开它，点击driver versi旁的一个扳手样的按钮，弹出profile settings界面
左上角有一个profile，如果之前有在nvidia控制面板里配置过游戏，那么在下拉菜单直接找到游戏路径，按以下方式修改即可:
1把Transparency supersampling项改为
4x sparse grid supersampling (该项是关键)
2把Anisotropic filtering改为 16x 或 8x
3把FXAA 改为 on
修改完点击右上角的apply changes即可。
3.进入游戏，Alt+Enter三次，介时将切换至全屏和60帧哦！
小妹的配置是Geforce710M的小笔记本而已，用了这个办法亲测可行！
当然我也知道还有很多问题，以及忍受着这些问题却依然进行游玩的有爱的玩家，我相信Arc works会有所行动的（4-28日已经更新两个补丁）

解决了这个问题之后就可以爽快地游玩啦~
如果你在网战时遇到一个叫做Fianna Snow的玩家
如果她使用的是粉白色的Es
请好好疼爱她！

31439744.review:
I feel I have to give this game at least a brief positive review. There's a lot of negativity going on, and I don't think it's right.

I do have a beast of a computer, but the game still runs well for me. There were the resolution errors at launch, but there has already been a patch addressing it. There was even a workaround pre-patch that nobody liked talking about. I also never had the 50Hz problem. I don't know what's up with that.

I'm not saying the game's perfect. Actual hardware requirements may be a lot higher than previous Blazblue games, and that's a bit of a head scratcher. The menu control thing when remapping buttons is weird, but it's something SSF4AE/USF4 did, so it's not unique to this game. The install size is bonkers. Hopefully that means we're getting the highest quality assets because I wouldn't have a problem with that.

Anyway, I'm not even that much of a Blazblue fan. I much prefer Guilty Gear. Still, I don't think the game deserves the hate that's been slung in its direction lately.

31439210.review:
想说的事很多，打出一篇删一篇。最终敲下本文，这不是评测，作为一个剧情党也不会评测。只想写下此时的心情。
刚刚通关了BBCF剧情模式，剧情结束的余韵带来的感动平息了我因为最近steam上闹心的2小时涨价事件的心情。
作为一个从厄运扳机打到神观之梦的bb粉丝来说。这游戏虽然又挖坑，而且又联动到其他游戏里的坑。但作为本系列结局非常好。
拉格纳的结局让我想到了风色幻想6的男主角迪恩·凡尔赛提斯。同样是金发（曾经），同样是一个少女的愿望中诞生，最终同样弑神（照美大爷走好，天照和拉格纳过上了幸福美满的日子）。
最终，两人（。。。。行踪不明的是风5的男主角，反正都一样。）都下落不明（祭奠天国的风色7和被人遗忘的拉格纳）。

31439039.review: 本来想至少把剧情看完再来给好评的，不过这两天steam各种奇葩忍不住了。bb既然是视觉小说送格斗小游戏，先说剧情，虽然我目前只玩了一点，但是除了作为系列的完结，还有主角小时候的剧情补完，系列老粉可以期待。演出效果也很棒，全篇都有种刻之幻影最后几章演出发力的既视感。不愧50g。。网战还没试，毕竟手残，比较胆小，不敢打。这作的网络状况，看别人打貌似还不错。格斗也就稍微打了打挑战，感觉历代老角色个别招式有改动，和刻之幻影差别不大，刻之幻影的新角色改变倒挺大的。不过本作新角色大多有派生技能，感觉都是上手简单精通难的角色。当然再次声明本人FTG水平垃圾，以上是一些拙见，说的不对的地方，求大神指点。还有就是bbpc版的通病，人物贴图分辨率低导致全身狗牙。虽然官方及时跟新，但狗牙问题依旧存在。不过本人是A卡党，游戏内设置没有抗锯齿选项，我用显卡驱动自带的抗锯齿调到8x，感觉效果好多了。至于n卡怎么调，本人手头没有，不敢瞎说。最后就是游戏的售价了，也是为什么没忍住写好评的原因。最近大米开卖，虽然定价高，流程短，初版游戏有bug，但至少没随便改定价。不过bb只要112！简直爽爆！好吗。光游戏容量50g就不知道高到哪里去了。真后悔之前买了刻之幻影，现在全4作合集打折只要160，真想要啊。

31429098.review:
While I do believe this is an inferior port and that the PS4 version is better. I think the speedy release of the 1.01 patch helped a lot. Personally, I never actually got to play vanilla as I had not purchased until the exact day 1.01 lauched, by sheer coincedence. So I guess that's cool, but I also don't have anything to compare it to either. Now I will say that this game does STILL look more pixilated than the PS4 version. Now I ain't runnin on no 1080p so that could be the cause but I still don't think it's an excuse, your game should look decent no matter what the res is (within reason of course). I find my game only lags on the anime cutscenes (wierd but I know a workaround to sort of fix that) and durring Exeed Accel attacks. Haven't tried astrals yet. So basically, it's slightly more demanding on your computer than CPEX, but not really by a whole lot. And I'm not sure why either, considering CPEX actually looks cleaner even on lowered settings. I also don't get why it's so freaking big. 52 Gigs? Seriously? Why tho? 

If you have a PS4 get it on there. It's just better. Straight up. If you already have PS4 version, don't really waste your time with this one. BUT if you're like me and PC is your only path to some sweet BlazBlue goodness, it's still worth the buy. I'm faithful that Arks will continue to work on this version to make it as close to perfect as possible. I mean crap how fast did 1.01 come out? Dang that was fast. Gameplay is solid, and that matters more to me than anything, that and the story (but crap I'm still backed up at CSEX in that regard). 

TLDR; It's worth it, but it does depend on your situation. Not worth buying again if you have console.

Pro's

Meh's

31420755.review:
The (tentatively) final chapter of BlazBlue is pretty good, and I'm actually quite satisfied with the port.

The game itself has no major problems, though the issue of port quality does come up every now and then.

A little bit of configuration is required:

1.) The game defaults to using the onboard integrated graphic card, so you need to play around with some settings (Nvidia Control Panel in my case) to make sure the game is using the correct card.

2.) The game also locks itself to 50FPS, though a workaround that worked for me was to set the game to run on full windowed (i.e. borderless fullscreen). This got me to 60FPS right away, and I was getting to work with the game like I did with BBCPEX.

The team behind the port is still working on ironing out the kinks (still being patched), so I'm confident it'd turn out as solid as the BBCPEX port is soon. I don't really pay much attention to issues regarding sprite quality (game already looks great to me), and the control scheme is decent enough. so I guess your mileage may vary. But with all the DLC included, and this being basically a working port, I'm quite satisfied with the purchase.

Edit: It has recent come to my attention that an alternative fix to the 50FPS problem (point 2) in fullscreen is to disable Vsync (be sure to alt+tab out of the game and go back in for it to actually take effect). The monitor will still display at 50Hz, but the game will run at 60FPS. You'd experience some screen tearing as a result, but it's a good workaround nonetheless if windowed mode (and its variants) don't work well for you.

Edit2: As of v1.03 (released on 11 May 2017), the issue of the game locking to 50 FPS with fullscreen and VSYNC enabled has been resolved for me.

31420650.review: If you enjoy Blazblue then get this game. It's the last one they're making and it's definitely the best. There are quite a few errors in this port so you'll have to be a bit patient and maybe change out of windowed mode and mess with the resolution. They are patching it as they can but they put it on Steam a full year earlier than normal so it's definitely got some bugs, but the game itself is perfectly playable.

31413584.review:
CS版AC版をプレイしての全体的なレビューです。ご了承下さい。

BLAZBLUEシリーズは2008/11/20にアーケードゲームとして稼働を始めた。対戦型格闘ゲームである。
これまでカラミティトリガー(CT)、コンティニアムシフト(CS)、クロノファンタズマ(CP)、そして今作セントラルフィクション(CF)へと続く。

はっきりと言わせてもらえば格ゲーとしては旧作のCTやCSの方がバランスがよくまた、遊んでてて楽しいです。
どちらかというと今作や前作のCP、CFはストーリーにとても力を入れてる感じがします[strike]ARC特有のアレ[/strike]

格ゲー面はほんとに新規キャラのインフレが凄まじすぎて既存キャラの活躍の場がかなり減って来てる印象です。

AC版ではじめの頃はよく遊んでたので今更画質は気にならないですが10年近くもう経っているのに進歩がそこまで見られない気がします。
ここまで批判ばかり並べましたがストーリーの方は凄いです！格ゲーのストーリーとは思えません！CT、CSはほんとに序章って感じでこんな人物像ですーくらいだったんですがCPからのストーリーはとても濃厚で各キャラそれぞれに過去があり、夢がありでそれぞれのストーリーが今作で終わりを迎えます。
今作はストーリーを進めるとそのまま流れて進んでいきますがサイドストーリーが解放されたら面倒ですが一度本編を中断してサイドストーリーも読み進めてみてください。
ストーリーにさらに深みがまして真相が解明されていきます。(内容には触れれないのでここまで)

最後に総評ですが、
格ゲーとしては7/10

ノベルゲーとしては10/10
という感じです。
最後は本当にラグナ君は主人公してました。普通に感動しました。
皆さんもぜひお手に取ってみてはいかがでしょう？

그레도 구매를 망설일 가치는 있습니다.

Here's what you can expect from this game:
+ A tutorial for people new to the genre
+ A lot of characters; each one has unique gameplay
+ A lot of single player content, and visual novel style story mode
+ Great online experience with optimal net code
+ Top notch 2D sprites
+ Compatible with keyboard and many controllers, Xbox and non-Xbox.

Performs perfectly on my old laptop.

31409122.review:
Central Fiction is not just the fourth installment of the same game you already purchased trice. It also is the most casual friendly entry of the series so far. Blazblue is not just about fighting, it features a rich and deep anime trope heavy but engaging story as well as various game modes to keep you busy.

Arcade & Story
Arcade and Story Mode is one of the three staples the series got to offer. Spread across multiple chapters and up to 3 acts per characters arcade mode, it’s a story rich and short timed experience.

The second staple of the series are the Additional Modes, Abyss, Score Attack and Speedstar Mode.

Abyss
Central Fiction’s Abyss is by far the best iteration of the Abyss yet. It combines the infamous Unlimited Mars with the Chronophantasmas Abyss Mode. Eight 100 depths deep stages need to be conquered. By defeating opponents you unlock grimoires to equip and items and skills to upgrade them, as well as gaining experience to level up, which makes you stronger in overcoming later stages. A specific amount of bosses in the formerly unlimited mars called boss rush mode also needs to be reached to progress even further.

Score Attack
The score attack is back. This time with various difficulties and courses to go through. Which gives us casuals the chance to adjust the difficulty to our skillevel, unlike the previous iterations that were too hard 

Speedstar
It’s some sort of survival mode in which you take on the timer while having infinite health. By using special attacks and maneuvers you can regain seconds on the timer. If you run out of time before defeating the last opponent you have to start over.

Competitive
The third staple includes the competitive online features. Face other players in ranked battle or customize your room and gamertag with avatars, furniture and more to invite other players for a tea party with cookies and even more fighting!

In Blazblue Central Fiction is something to be found for everyone. So hook up your gamepad onto your PC and enjoy yourself.

31408364.review:
[b]Edited with recommendation change as of 4/30[/b]

I said I would be happy to change my stance as issues were handled, and I meant it. As of the 1.01 patch, several issues have been tackled that, in my opinion, change this to a worthy purchase. The handling of resolution has been remedied, so the sprites and menus are no longer strangely mismatched in the way they were before. In addition (or perhaps because of that) the new connection issues my friends and I were facing have lessened as well, now just barely above Chronophantasma-level when we played before. Some hard-to-diagnose performance problems remain, but there is definite improvement in that regard too.

On a related note, I would seriously like to commend H2 for their alacrity. It gives me hope for the support of this game.

Original review lies below, for posterity or some such.

---\/---

Okay, so here's another negative review to add to the pile, but let me at least say my piece here. As a preface, I'm holding this to the standard of the last BlazBlue game in the series released on PC — and let me be the first to say that this is somewhat unfair. It was called Chronophantasma [b]Extend[/b] for a reason: It was a full, confident port and I would almost say semi-remaster of the Playstation version.

This game (Centralfiction) is definitely not that. And, proceeding with that knowledge in mind, I [i]still[/i] can't recommend this for the price. That's more or less all you need to glean from this review, but if you want to read further I'll list my reasons. (Normal disclaimer applies: I am not a professional reviewer or fighting game player, I play with a group of friends and have since Continuum Shift.)

The first point you see in these reviews, and one that I will echo, is performance issues crippling the gameplay. The game is pointlessly performance-heavy, to the point where not only will graphics cards beefy enough to take on new AAA titles have trouble, but the people who were playing on potato PCs that could run the previous titles are absolutely shat on. One of the friends in the aforementioned group is more than capable of playing Chrono with me and has for ages, but Centralfiction consistently delivers unplayable framerates and stutters even when measures are taken to reduce CPU demand to the bare minimums. And some people here have found more non-standard fixes — that's excellent! I am extremely glad that people perservere, truly, but at the same time I cannot support the idea that the game requires work from the player to be brought up to the standards of [i]previous titles[/i].

A second point is another one I've experienced with friends: The ever-ambiguous 'netcode'. To be frank, I am not a network engineer, and port forwarding is about where my expertise stops. But all the same, I know there is something wrong with the game's handling of the connection between me and another of my friends. In Chronophantasma, it was palpable when one of our connections was bad — there would be slowdowns, frame drops, other common presentations of lag. But the point being that it passed, both of our connections generally being reliable and fast. Centralfiction honestly gave me the impression that my wifi was shorting out. We have never gone a round without a freeze, a gigantic lag spike slowing our characters to 1/10th their speeds, or in some cases just outright disconnections. We seriously both went to check if anything was downloading in the background, or if we were having apocalyptic-level packet loss somewhere, but we came up empty handed. After that we turned on FPS counters to make sure it wasn't our actual performance, and it wasn't that either — solid 60 the whole time. This is still a mystery that needs solving, so I was hesitant to put it in the review, but from everything I've been hearing it looks like we are not the only victims of this.

The third is definitely less severe than the first two, but nonetheless deserves mention: This game looks bad. I don't mean to put it in such stark terms, but Jesus Christ — the sprites, the menu, everything but the character art itself looks like it's a blown up jpeg. Even in matches, the sprites are rough-edged beyond what any of the previous games drew, despite them being exactly the same in many cases. This would be easily forgiven in my opinion, if it weren't for the fact that the performance is also [i]worse![/i] This definitely seems petty, but if you're going to make the game look objectively worse than the last, you need to at least make it run easier than that last as well.

Now, I cannot personally speak on the lack of English voice actors, as I haven't looked into that whole mess. What I can say is that the subs are... Not great. The Engrish factor is relatively high in places, and as a grammar nazi this occasionally [strike]sends me into apoplectic fits[/strike] irritates me. Also worth mentioning is the lack of combat subtitles — what is Izanami saying to Noel as she stands there looking all downcast? [i]The world may never know.[/i]

This all boils down to the idea that if you have been playing the last games in the series and enjoyed the quality of those ports, you will be sorely disappointed with this one. I am. Not to the point of refunding (hell, the troubleshooting alone put me over the 2 hour limit, seriously) because I dearly, desperately hope that they will patch many of these issues out. It would make me extremely happy to be able to come back and change this review to a positive one, but with the game as it is now, I cannot in good conscience recommend buying it.

[Edit: Spelling fix]

31404185.review:
Итак. Новая часть ББ порадовала Пеку и всех кто любит серию. Но не обошлось и без классики ПК-релизов - кривой оптимизации и всратости управления.

Графен - наконец-то пофиксили. До фикса все было невероятно всрато и мыльно-пиксельно. Играть было возможно, но это было тяжко и больно для глаз.
Понимаете в чем дело, первые 2 месяца после старта продаж был баг графона на экранах размером ниже чем FullHD. Баг портил разрешение с 1920p на 160p вне зависимости от качества настроек. Что ни ставь - было убогое разрешение без какого либо сглаживания, а еще игра тормозила даже на железе близком к топовому.
АРКи поняли что так делать НЕ НУЖНО, пофиксив разрешение спрайтов и сглаживание. Ныне игра сияет как хорошо обработанный алмаз. Давайте скажем разрабам спасибо, ведь не каждый разраб так заботится о своих покупателях :'333

По части геймплея - тут все как всегда шикарно. У нас тут аж 7 новых персонажей - все безумно классные, идеально вписываются в сюжетище, у всех потрясный дизайн и привлекательное управление. Каждый раз при запуске хочется играть именно ими. Впервые такое ощущение знаете ли.

Новые персонажи:
Эс - лоли-кудере с огромным мечем. Обоятельна, молчалива и довольно медленно атакует мечем который в 2 раза больше её самой.
Наото - пафосный ОЯШ дерущийся руками и косплеющий ОРИДЖИНАЛ но при этом его образ попахивает "Рагной" и "Роком Говардом" из KoF. В принципе юзает те же скиллы что и рагна, но дерется в рукопашную и способен создавать меч из красной энергии на пару секунд. Нереально эффектно выглядит. Он вам понравится, я гарантирую это.
Сусаноо - НЕХ, жуткий тип. Медленно двигается и очень сильно бьёт. Эдакий "ONI" из StreetFighter, но от мира BB. Просто оцените сами.
Хибики - ЛЕВИ из АТАКИ ТИТАНОВ. Серьезно. Выглядит так же, и даже оружие такое же! ТОЧЬ В ТОЧЬ. По сюжету является подручным альфача Кагуро, а боевой образ скорее всего создавался под волной хайпа по титанам. И что тут можно сказать? Ультрастильно получилось, особенно когда после победы он заменяет лезвия в своих мечах. Сука, это оч круто. Ах да, играть им оч легко.
МАИ - причина покупки новой части ББ. Сисястая тян с копьём, которая на самом деле кун. Короче трап. Но это долгая история. Дебютировала в прошлой части в режиме микроновелки HeartRemix где была гг. Чтож, это самый простой в освоении персонаж за всю историю ББ. Выглядит классно, сексуально и мегастильно. Неподготовленный игрок будет шокирован её предысторией, но кстати раскрыли её как персонажа - достаточно годно. Я не возлагал на неё таких больших надежд, но получилось и правда классно. Вообщем она божественна. Лучшая девочка тайтла. Я гарантирую это.
Изанами - третий по важности главгад. Абсолютное зло. Дальше тупо спойлеры. Имеет два стиля стражений - сменяющихся при нажатии клавиши "D". Сложна для освоения.
НАЙН ЗЕ ФЕНТОМ - одна из 6 ТЕХ САМЫХ ЛЕГЕНДАРНЫХ ГЕРОЕВ, только поехала и перешедшая на темную сторону. Не оценил, так как фапал на МАИ, Селику и Коконоэ с Ноэль.

Сюжетище - теперь в режиме аркады аж целых 3 ветки. Каждая ветка отличается катсценами и сюжетными боями. Оч круто кстати придумали. В самом же сюжетном режиме сделали очень прикольный интерфейс, с таймлайном и главами.
Коротко о самом сюжете - если вы не играли в все предыдущие тайтлы - вы ничего не поймете.
Дизайн меню снова вернулся к 2 части. Из-за поломанного графона оценить по достоинству не получается, но видно что годно.
Музыка - новые треки ОК, старые будто вообще не меняли.

Итог: Годно, очень годно. Очень скоро добавят Джубея, поэтому ящитаю что 10/10.

31404055.review:
作为一个铁粉，PSV上出过的全买了，steam上的今天也终于集齐全套了。
虽说很惭愧，但姑且还有点资格，做一点微小的的评测。

实话说本来没想着来测评的，不过看见隔壁SE的尼尔顶风涨价硬生生把价格翻个倍的吃相实在难看，看着这边顿时觉得舒心不少。
又是苍翼故事的完结，还是来码个字，纪念一下。

首先是首发几天后很多人反馈的PC优化问题。
苍翼默示录这个系列在PC上优化不佳这个老毛病，实话说不是这代才有的。
从BBCT自微软平台转战STEAM平台以后，基本上每代都总有这样那样的瑕疵。

作为一个只是拿来收集和重温的重度用户，就我个人而言对这些细枝末节并不是很在意。只要你有个能用的手柄，肯下功夫在设置里调整一下。应该对游戏体验不会有什么太大的影响。（除非你就是喜欢用键盘打格斗游戏，而且中文的设置菜单也懒得去看）
至于联网这个问题嘛......就笔者目前体验而言并不是非常的完善，不过这玩意毕竟不是网游，以笔者目前的估计，最终的联机对战的效果也就和之前几作持平吧，不要指望A社还会为了我们这群小众用户另外专门开设搞得和DOTA、LOL一样的高质量联网服务器。A社不太可能有这个预算。
况且从steam平台才开始了解苍翼的用户怕只是占了很小的一部分，PC用户又只占总用户的一小部分，所以A社是有点有恃无恐了吧，或者打开始就没把PC移植作为业务重点，在这方面没有技术也没有下足功夫。
不过好在A社在中文化和后续跟进一直做得很认真，这点不得不称赞一下，相信头两天的这些问题，会慢慢改善的吧。虽说自己作为一个有N1日语的日呆，平时打游戏看动画没有中文也毫无压力。不过难得能看到一个日厂这么重视中国市场而且苍翼又是我最喜欢的游戏之一，两件快乐事情重合在一起。而这两份快乐，又给我带来更多的快乐。得到的，是像梦境一般幸福的时间......
恩......再说下去，怕是要被打死。


------------以下段落可能涉及剧透，请心惊胆颤地往下阅读------------


这次的苍翼终于迎来了完结篇，回首第一次接触苍翼系列的时候还是在高中，现在已经大学毕业两年多了。真的是感叹时间飞逝。
期间出过动画、小说、漫画。一路走到今天苍翼应该也算是个不小的系列吧。
主人公拉格纳也一步一步地从被轮回地命运玩弄棋子成长为打破所有的枷锁、背负罪恶、拯救他人的英雄。
非常感谢A社这么多年来坚持地耕耘这个让我这个中二之心常驻的傻瓜热血沸腾的故事。
接下来A社应该会把精力都放在GG上面吧，即使只是小说也好，希望A社能继续让BB的角色们继续活跃下去就好了。

只能说谢谢这么多年的陪伴吧，让我们以后有缘再会了。

31400194.review:
Alright, alright, already mixed reviews but still I'm upvoting this.

And here's why:

When a game ports to pc people expect it to look better and feel smoother and when that doesn't happen they're mad. This game has 60 fps and all but doesn't look as good as other games on pc, which people do not like. But if we don't look at the game like a port but as just a game then the game is still really fcking good.

Yeah it might not have glorious graphics, but it still looks good. The fighting feels good and is in terms of fighting games quite easy to pick up but still it's a fighting game so it's hard to master. The characters are diverse and are all extremely fun, and sidenote, we have all characters unlocked without even having to buy the DLC. And god I love the new mechanics, feels good man.

The story continues from where Chronophantasma ended, but let's say that you've never played Blazblue before (in which case, you've missed something my friend) they'll still explain all events in 30-ish minutes at the start of the game so you can pick it up quite easily. And god the story is a mindfuck and a half. I was so confused at the start but I'm starting to understand it and it's fcking great. I love the story and the little fights mixed up in it.

Also we have a few gamemodes for if you're bored with the standard combat, so there's that. (They're good fun).

So TLDR:
Bad port, amazing game. Good gameplay, fun characters, epic story and neat gamemodes. People are telling you guys to wait for a patch, but if you wait you're missing out on some good sht so just buy it, enjoy it, and live it. Wait wut?

31396731.review:
I get pixelated graphics for anything lower than my native resolution which is 1920x1080, so if you have this problem, just change your resolution. Also, it's best to run the game in borderless window mode. I haven't had any other issues. My PS3 fight stick works fine. My FPS is contantly 60. Everything is all good on my end, but they certainly need to iron out the aforementioned problems.

Other than that, the game is a good upgrade to CP. I was initially not going to purchase this coming from CP, but for $32 I couldn't resist. It turned out to be a lot better than I expected. The only things that are technically a downgrade is the lack of an English dub and no unlimited characters, both of which I really do not care about, personally.

I may update my review with more detail as I play more, I just wanted to push this review out for anyone who may be having issues, or concerns.

Old review below VV


At this moment in time, i can not recommend this game it has some major issues the port seems to have technical issues that will hopefully be fixed over time.

- It looks really bad compared console counterparts (even the PS3 version looks superior). It even looks worse than the previous titles on Steam somehow.

-The optimization is awful. If you thought the 50gb would at least make the game run well, you would be very wrong sadly

-No English dub. So we get five times the installation size but are put down to only a Japanese track for this release compared to its prequels, something seems wrong there. Even worse fans have been asking for an English dub since 2016.Personal view that Japanese & English dub versions should be in the same game in 2017.

-Cancel/Confirm buttons are bound to whatever you set C/D to making for some awkward placements depending on how you have your buttons set up and which type of controller you use

This is the swan song for the Blazblue series and it's a shame that PC owners get slightly shafted so it might leave a sour taste in your mouth about the series as a whole if you pick up the game in its current form. I will be more than happy to change my review of this game and talk about the positives once a lot of the issues have been fixed.

31392799.review:
Cuando salió este juego, le dí un analisis negativo. El juego en sí estaba bien, pero el port dejaba algo que desear. Ahora que ya ha transcurrido un tiempo desde su salida y en vista de los arreglos que se han ido realizando con las actualizaciones, creo que este juego se merece finalmente que lo recomiende.

Originalmente, el juego contenía fallos gráficos (los pixeles de los sprites de los personajes se veían de forma muy extraña) y el juego tenía problemas de fluidez (sobre todo si no tienes un ordenador más a menos potente). Por fortuna, a día de hoy, estos problemas parecen haber desaparecido con las actualizaciones que se fueron aplicando a lo largo del tiempo.

Me gustaría destacar además, que estube visitando con frecuencia el foro del juego cuando dichos problemas estaban aún presentes (para ver si salían noticias al respecto), y la persona al cargo del port parecía estar bastante activa y receptiva con los problemas que se nos presentaban por nuestra parte, así que desde aquí agradezco su labor y su paciencia.

En resumidas cuantas, un juego bastante entretenido. Si has jugado a algún otro juego de BlazBlue y te gustó, no hay duda alguna que este te gustará incluso más. Si por el contrario nunca antes has jugado a ningún otro juego de BlazBlue pero te gusta el género, este puede ser un buen título para añadir a tu colección.

31391124.review:
블레이블루 시리즈의 종지부
센트럴 픽션이 드디오 스팀에 발매를 시작했습니다.

게임성으로만 보면 역대시리즈중 가장 수작이지만, 이번 센트럴 픽션의 스팀판은 역대 블레이블루의 스팀작중 이식은 가장 촤악이라고 생각이듭니다. 물론 몇몇분들은 정상적으로도 플레이가 가능하지만, 대부분들은 전작 CPEX보다 더 난해한 키설정과 해상도, 그리고 최적화, 넷플레이의 문제가 보입니다.

키설정의 부분은 그나마 낫지만 게임이 격투게임인만큼 프레임이 중요한데, 이번 스팀판은 최적화가 잘 안되있습니다. 특히, 디스토션 드라이브나 익시드 엑셀등 연출이 화려한 필살기들을 사용하면 더욱 심각하고요. 또한 해상도의 문제로 게임내 도트가 뭉개져있는 현상도 보입니다. 빠른 시일내에 수정해주었으면 좋겟네요.

이식만 보면 최악이지만, 인생게임이라 추천은 박고갑니다. 핰
